text: It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men.
author: Frederick Douglass

text: I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naive or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman.
author: Anais Nin

text: Men always want to be a woman's first love - women like to be a man's last romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Without feelings of respect, what is there to distinguish men from beasts?
author: Confucius

text: Man becomes great exactly in the degree in which he works for the welfare of his fellow-men.
author: Mahatma Gandhi
